body_html:
Also note that Python garbage collection is going to be a source of noise in your benchmark (if you measure over thousands of runs) -- you can either use timeit [1] which turns off GC or you can use TensorFlow tracing [2] [3] to measure the op timing from within TensorFlow.

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/timeit.html
[2] https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.8/api_docs/python/client.html#Session.run
[3]

tensorflow/tensorflow/core/protobuf/config.proto

Line 146 in fe45446

message RunOptions {

Pass a RunOptions proto with trace_level == FULL_TRACE and an empty RunMetadata proto to session.run and you'll get some tracing metrics for the run.

body:
Also note that Python garbage collection is going to be a source of noise in your benchmark (if you measure over thousands of runs) -- you can either use timeit [1] which turns off GC or you can use TensorFlow tracing [2] [3] to measure the op timing from within TensorFlow.

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/timeit.html
[2] https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.8/api_docs/python/client.html#Session.run
[3] https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/fe454464681b036ff7fed3e42c6bb541fa52dd7c/tensorflow/core/protobuf/config.proto#L146

Pass a RunOptions proto with trace_level == FULL_TRACE and an empty RunMetadata proto to session.run and you'll get some tracing metrics for the run.
